definitions: being the same in quantity, size, degree, or value as another
having the same rights, status, or opportunities as others in society
examples: The two pieces of cake are equal in size
We need equal amounts of flour and sugar for recipe
All citizens deserve equal treatment under the law
The company promotes equal opportunities for all employees

definitions: having been owned or employed by someone else before
familiar with something through past experience or practice
examples: She bought a used car from the dealership
The bookstore sells both new and used textbooks
He's used to working late hours at office
After living there for years, I'm used to the noise

definitions: of, from, or characteristic of Russia, its people, culture, or language
examples: She's studying Russian literature at the university
The restaurant serves traditional Russian dishes like borscht

definitions: of or concerning the former Soviet Union, its government, or its people
examples: The museum displays artifacts from the Soviet era
Many Soviet-style buildings remain in Eastern European cities

definitions: making sure to avoid potential danger, mishap, or harm
giving serious attention and thought to avoid mistakes or omissions
examples: Be careful when crossing the busy street
She's always careful with sharp kitchen knives
The scientist was careful to record every detail
Please be careful not to spill paint on carpet

definitions: not recognized, known, or able to be named or identified
examples: Police found an unidentified body in the river
The radar detected an unidentified flying object last night

definitions: relating to the running of a home or to family relations
existing or occurring inside a particular country rather than foreign
examples: She handles most of the domestic chores around house
Domestic violence is a serious social problem worldwide
The company focuses on domestic markets rather than exports
Domestic flights are usually cheaper than international ones

definitions: of, from, or characteristic of England, its people, culture, or language
examples: She teaches English grammar at the local school
The pub serves traditional English breakfast every morning

definitions: relating to an authority or public body and its duties or activities
having the approval or authorization of an authority or organization
examples: The mayor made an official statement about the policy
She received an official letter from the government
The official opening ceremony is scheduled for next Monday
This is the official version of the company report

definitions: feeling or showing surprise because of something unexpected
examples: She looked surprised when she saw the birthday cake
He was surprised to find his keys in refrigerator

definitions: exceptionally large in size, quantity, or extent
large and heavy or solid in build or structure
examples: The company suffered massive losses during the recession
A massive crowd gathered for the concert downtown
The castle walls are made of massive stone blocks
That old oak table is too massive to move

definitions: free of deceit and untruthfulness; sincere in character and actions
fairly earned or gained without cheating or stealing
examples: She's known for being an honest and reliable person
I want your honest opinion about my presentation
He makes an honest living as a carpenter
It was an honest mistake with no bad intentions

definitions: used or accepted as normal or average in quality
established as a model or rule for measuring or judging
examples: The hotel room was clean but pretty standard
This is standard procedure for all new employees
The industry follows standard safety regulations for workers
These measurements conform to international standard units

definitions: extremely good in quality or of an outstanding standard
examples: The restaurant is known for its excellent seafood dishes
She received excellent grades in all her subjects

definitions: relating to crime or the legal punishment of criminal behavior
examples: He has an extensive criminal record from past convictions
The detective specializes in criminal investigations of fraud

definitions: relating to Judaism, Jewish people, their culture, or their history
examples: They celebrate Jewish holidays with their extended family
The museum has an exhibit on Jewish art history

definitions: free from moisture or liquid; not wet or moist
lacking interest, excitement, or emotional expression
prohibiting the sale or consumption of alcoholic drinks
examples: The desert climate is extremely hot and dry
Hang the clothes outside until they're completely dry
His dry sense of humor isn't appreciated by everyone
The professor's dry lectures put students to sleep
This county has been dry since the 1930s
The wedding reception was dry at bride's request

definitions: of, from, or characteristic of India, its people, culture, or language
examples: She loves cooking traditional Indian curry dishes at home
The store sells beautiful Indian silk scarves and fabrics

definitions: contrary to or forbidden by law, especially criminal law
examples: Parking here is illegal and you'll get a ticket
The company was fined for illegal dumping of waste

definitions: dedicated or consecrated to God or a religious purpose
morally and spiritually excellent or virtuous
examples: Jerusalem is considered a holy city by three religions
The priest blessed the holy water before the ceremony
Mother Teresa was regarded as a holy woman
He leads a holy life devoted to helping others

definitions: situated in, directed toward, or coming from the east
examples: The eastern coast gets more rainfall than the west
Many eastern European countries joined the EU recently

definitions: of first importance or highest rank in quality
of the best possible quality or excellence
relating to the most active or successful period
examples: Location is the prime factor in real estate value
The prime minister addressed the nation last night
This restaurant serves only prime cuts of beef
The gallery displays prime examples of modern art
Athletes typically reach their prime in their twenties
The actor was in his prime during the 1960s

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a city or densely populated area
examples: Urban planning is crucial for managing city growth effectively
She prefers urban living to quiet suburban neighborhoods

definitions: situated on the inside of something or someone
existing or occurring within an organization or country
examples: The doctor examined her internal organs using ultrasound
The phone's internal storage is almost full
The company conducted an internal investigation of the incident
This is an internal matter for our department

definitions: responsible for a specified wrongdoing or crime as judged
feeling shame or remorse for having done something wrong
examples: The jury found the defendant guilty of theft
She was guilty of breaking the company's policy
He felt guilty about forgetting his mother's birthday
She had a guilty conscience after lying to friend

definitions: lacking physical strength, energy, or vigor
lacking power to convince or persuade effectively
containing little of a particular substance or ingredient
examples: She felt weak after being sick for several days
The bridge is too weak to support heavy trucks
His weak argument failed to convince the committee
That's a pretty weak excuse for missing work
This coffee is too weak for my taste
The weak solution won't clean these tough stains

definitions: relating to the Roman Catholic Church or its members
including a wide variety of things; all-embracing in interests
examples: She attends Catholic mass every Sunday morning
The Catholic school requires students to wear uniforms
He has catholic tastes in music, from classical to hip-hop
Her catholic interests include art, science, and literature

definitions: not known or seen by others; kept hidden deliberately
examples: They met at a secret location to discuss plans
She kept her illness secret from her coworkers

definitions: excellent, extremely good, or of high quality
of a size, extent, or degree exceeding what is normal
examples: The kids had a super time at the amusement park
That's a super idea for the school fundraiser
The store sells super-sized portions of everything
This detergent has super cleaning power for tough stains

definitions: willing to respect or accept behavior or opinions different from own
given, used, or occurring in generous amounts
relating to political views favoring reform and individual freedoms
examples: She has liberal views on social issues
The university promotes a liberal education in arts
Add a liberal amount of olive oil to pan
He was liberal with his praise for the team
The liberal party won the election last year
She supports liberal policies on healthcare reform

definitions: having little thickness between opposite surfaces
having few parts or members relative to the area
lacking substance, depth, or strength
examples: She sliced the bread into thin pieces for sandwiches
The walls are so thin you can hear everything
His thin hair barely covers his scalp anymore
The mountain air is thin at high altitudes
That's a pretty thin excuse for being late
The plot of the movie was disappointingly thin

definitions: not occurring very often or not common
meat cooked for only a short time
examples: Snow is rare in this part of the country
She collects rare stamps from around the world
He ordered his steak rare with a side salad
The center should be red if it's cooked rare

definitions: situated in, directed toward, or coming from the north
examples: The northern regions experience colder winters than the south
She has a slight northern accent from growing up there

definitions: having the ability to create imaginative or original ideas
examples: She found creative solutions to complex business problems
The creative team designed an innovative marketing campaign

definitions: taking everything into account; considering all aspects together
examples: The overall cost of the project exceeded our budget
Her overall performance this semester has been excellent

definitions: occurring over or relating to a long period of time
examples: Smoking has serious long-term effects on your health
They're looking for long-term investment opportunities

definitions: suggesting something supernatural; uncanny or strikingly odd
examples: She heard weird noises coming from the basement
He has some weird habits that nobody can explain

definitions: existing or occurring at the beginning of something
examples: The initial response to the product was very positive
Please pay the initial deposit to secure your booking

definitions: belonging to the very distant past, especially before recorded history
examples: Archaeologists discovered ancient pottery at the dig site
The ancient Egyptians built magnificent pyramids thousands years ago

definitions: of a color like that of dark wood, earth, or coffee
examples: She wore a brown leather jacket to the meeting
The leaves turn brown in autumn before falling off

definitions: absolutely necessary or extremely important for a particular purpose
examples: Water is essential for all forms of life on Earth
Good communication skills are essential for this job position

definitions: restricted in size, amount, extent, or scope
examples: The store has limited supplies of the popular toy
Her limited experience made finding a job more difficult

definitions: attractive in a delicate way without being beautiful
to a moderately high degree; fairly or considerably
examples: She wore a pretty dress to the garden party
The cottage has a pretty view of the lake
The exam was pretty difficult for most students
I'm pretty sure we've met somewhere before

definitions: done correctly according to rules or accepted standards
respectable and socially acceptable in behavior or appearance
belonging to the thing itself rather than something else
examples: You need proper training before operating this equipment
Make sure to use the proper form when lifting
She always dresses in proper attire for church
It's not proper to speak with your mouth full
We stayed in the suburbs, not London proper
The cost of the meal proper was reasonable

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a particular region or district
examples: The company opened several regional offices across the country
This dish is a regional specialty from southern Italy

definitions: not according with truth or fact; incorrect
appearing to be something that it is not; artificial
examples: The witness gave false testimony in court yesterday
These false rumors have damaged his reputation significantly
She wore false eyelashes to the formal event
The painting turned out to be a false masterpiece

definitions: having a large distance between opposite sides or surfaces
made up of many closely packed parts or particles
having a consistency that resists flow; viscous
examples: The castle walls are three feet thick
She cut thick slices of homemade bread
He has thick black hair that's hard to comb
The forest was so thick we couldn't see through
This milkshake is too thick to drink through a straw
Add water if the paint becomes too thick

definitions: made greater in size, amount, intensity, or degree
examples: The company reported increased profits this quarter
There's been increased interest in renewable energy lately

definitions: forming or viewed as a unit apart or by itself
not joined or touching physically
examples: Keep your work and personal emails in separate accounts
Each child has a separate bedroom in the house
The garage is separate from the main house
Please keep raw meat separate from other foods

definitions: of the color between green and orange in the spectrum
examples: She painted the kitchen walls a bright yellow color
The yellow school bus arrived right on time
